title: Hello with Quarto
text:
For a demonstration of a line plot on a polar axis, see Figure 1.


Code
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

r = np.arange(0, 2, 0.01)
theta = 4 * np.pi * r
fig, ax = plt.subplots(
  subplot_kw = {'projection': 'polar'} 
)
ax.plot(theta, r)
ax.set_rticks([0.5, 1, 1.5, 2])
ax.grid(True)
plt.show()





Figure 1: A line plot on a polar axis

title: Hello with Quarto

For a demonstration of a line plot on a polar axis, see Figure 1.


Code
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

r = np.arange(0, 2, 0.01)
theta = 4 * np.pi * r
fig, ax = plt.subplots(
  subplot_kw = {'projection': 'polar'} 
)
ax.plot(theta, r)
ax.set_rticks([0.5, 1, 1.5, 2])
ax.grid(True)
plt.show()

title: Yiqian Liu
text:
I am interested in visual stuff, including (first seen first)

geometry,
data visualization (e.g. isolines),
photography,
computer graphics, and
computer vision (e.g. object detection).

Bridge is my favorite hobby which is not so visual.

Education
MSc in Computer Science \(\cdot\) University of New Brunswick
Sep 2013 - May 2016 \(\cdot\) Fredericton, Canada
BSc in Mathematics \(\cdot\) Shandong University
Sep 2009 - Jun 2013 \(\cdot\) Jinan, China


Experience
Data Scientist \(\cdot\) NuData Security \(\cdot\) Mar 2022 - Jun 2023
Data Scientist \(\cdot\) Fortinet \(\cdot\) May 2017 - Feb 2022
Software Developer \(\cdot\) IBM \(\cdot\) Jan 2015 - Aug 2015
